rules: Rule1: Provided that artwork1 has documented provenance, it is authenticated.
Rule2: Whenever artwork1 is undergoing a chemical reaction, it is not the case that it is undergoing an oxidation process.
Rule3: Either artwork1 is undergoing a chemical reaction or it has documented provenance.

Rule4: Under the condition that gallery1 experiences temperature fluctuation, either artwork1 is exposed to ultraviolet light or, if artwork1 is undergoing a chemical reaction, then it is undergoing an oxidation process.

Rule5: If gallery1 experiences humidity fluctuation, then either artwork1 is exposed to ultraviolet light or, provided that artwork1 is undergoing a chemical reaction, it is undergoing an oxidation process.
Rule6: Whenever conservation treatment is applied to artwork1, preventive measures have been taken for artwork1.

Rule7: If material analysis is complete for artwork1, then either historical research is complete for artwork1, or if person3 has expertise in technique1, then if person2 has expertise in technique1, then under the condition that artwork1 is not authenticated, artwork1 is preserved.
Rule8: Material analysis is complete for artwork1 or scientific testing is complete for artwork1.
Rule9: Provided that person1 has expertise in technique1, if artwork1 is not authenticated, then artwork1 is preserved.
Rule10: Either person1 has expertise in technique1 or person2 has expertise in technique1.

Rule11: If scientific testing is complete for artwork1, then either historical research is complete for artwork1, or if person3 has expertise in technique1, then if person2 has expertise in technique1, then under the condition that artwork1 is not authenticated, artwork1 is preserved.

Rule12: Whenever a security system is installed in gallery1, then either light exposure is controlled in gallery1 or, if it is not the case that a stable environment in gallery1 implies artwork1 is authenticated, then artwork1 has visible damage.
Rule13: If public access is restricted for artwork1, then a display case is used for artwork1.
Rule14: Either public access is restricted for artwork1 or a security system is installed in gallery1.
Rule15: Provided that a display case is used for artwork1, climate control is activated in gallery1.
Rule16: If climate control is activated in gallery1, then emergency protocol is active in gallery1.
Rule17: Under the condition that climate control is activated in gallery1, it is not the case that emergency protocol is active in gallery1.
Rule18: Whenever loan is approved for artwork1, insurance is approved for artwork1.

Rule19: If the museum director approves artwork1, then if it is not the case that risk assessment complete for artwork1 implies that if it is not the case that gallery1 experiences temperature fluctuation or humidity fluctuation, then preventive measures have been taken for artwork1, then loan is approved for artwork1.
Rule20: Whenever staff training is complete for project1, it is not the case that budget allocation is made for project1.
Rule21: If pigment analysis is performed on artwork1, then if artwork1 is undergoing a chemical reaction, it is undergoing an oxidation process.
Rule22: Provided that binder analysis is performed on artwork1, if artwork1 is undergoing a chemical reaction, then it is undergoing an oxidation process.
Rule23: Under the condition that scientific study is initiated for artwork1, a research paper is published for artwork1.
Rule24: Whenever a natural disaster occurs in region1, it is not the case that peer review is passed for artwork1.
Rule25: A natural disaster occurs in region1 or an environmental crisis occurs in region1.
Rule26: Provided that an environmental crisis occurs in region1, it is not the case that peer review is passed for artwork1.
Rule27: Whenever artwork1 has visible damage, it is damaged.
Rule28: If artwork1 has structural weakness, then it has visible damage.
Rule29: Provided that it is not the case that gallery1 experiences temperature fluctuation or humidity fluctuation, conservation treatment has been applied to artwork1.

Rule30: If it is not the case that risk assessment complete for artwork1 implies that if it is not the case that gallery1 experiences temperature fluctuation or humidity fluctuation, then preventive measures have been taken for artwork1, then it is not the case that insurance is approved for artwork1.

Rule31: Provided that it is not the case that a research paper published for artwork1 implies that either pigment analysis is performed on artwork1 or binder analysis is performed on artwork1, peer review is passed for artwork1.

Rule32: If it is not the case that if person3 has expertise in technique1, then if person2 has expertise in technique1, then under the condition that artwork1 is not authenticated, artwork1 is preserved, then funding is approved for project1.

Rule33: Whenever it is not the case that if person3 has expertise in technique1, then if person2 has expertise in technique1, then provided that artwork1 is not authenticated, artwork1 is preserved, then it is not the case that funding is approved for project1.
Rule34: Provided that it is not the case that a stable environment in gallery1 implies artwork1 is authenticated, artwork1 has structural weakness.
Rule35: If it is not the case that a stable environment in gallery1 implies artwork1 is authenticated, then it is not the case that artwork1 is damaged.
Rule36: Whenever it is not the case that the museum director approves artwork1, budget allocation is made for project1.
Rule37: If it is not the case that the museum director approves artwork1, then staff training is complete for project1.
facts: Fact1: Risk assessment is complete for artwork1.
Fact2: Scientific study is initiated for artwork1.
Fact3: Person3 has expertise in technique1.
Fact4: Gallery1 has a stable environment.
Fact5: It is not the case that artwork1 is preserved.
Fact6: Artwork1 is not exposed to ultraviolet light.
Fact7: Preventive measures have not been taken for artwork1.
Fact8: Historical research is not complete for artwork1.
Fact9: Light exposure is not controlled in gallery1.
